span.strong: Family Resources & Information during COVID-19 Closure

p.span: To help prevent the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19) illness, the Governor's "Stay Home, Stay Safe" order has mandated that all schools in Washington close through the remainder of the school year. During this time, our schools will continue to support distance learning for all students, offer free meals Monday-Friday, and provide child care service for parents employed by health care and emergency response services.

Since closing, Snoqualmie Valley school staff have worked to identify resources, create support systems to continue to serve students, and communicate often, during this time of social distancing and quickly changing information. Please click on the categories below for detailed information by topic.

span.span: If you cannot find what you are looking for below, or have a new question, please email SVSDInfo@svsd410.org.
Currently most staff are working remotely and checking email regularly, so please refer to the staff directory to email a staff member. We appreciate your patience as we work through this closure.

div.a: 8001 Silva Ave SE/PO Box 400 Snoqualmie, WA 98065
